Person.description: Represents an individual human being, whether a customer, contact, or employee. Aligned with the O-CREAM (Ontology for Customer Relationship Management) concept of a party in a business relationship and the W3C Person Core Vocabulary. A person is a real individual, not a fictional character.

Organization.description: Represents a legal entity or a formal group of people with a particular purpose, such as a company, institution, or association. In the CRM context, it is typically the entity managing customer relationships or a business customer itself. Based on the O-CREAM concept of an enterprise or actor involved in business activities.

Email.description: A unique electronic address for sending and receiving messages.

PhoneNumber.description: A sequence of digits assigned to a telephone endpoint for routing calls.

Communication.description: Represents an interaction or exchange of information between parties, such as an email, call, or meeting. In O-CREAM, this is a central activity that connects organizations and individuals.

HAS_EMAIL.description: Links a person to their email.

HAS_PHONE.description: Links a person to their phone number.

PART_OF.description: An entity mentioned in or part of a communication.
